article.headline: Longwood 87, Shenandoah 68
article.story: FARMVILLE, Va. (AP) -- Dana Smith had 17 points and 10 rebounds to lead Longwood to an 87-68 win over Shenandoah on Wednesday night. Five other players scored in double digits for the Lancers (7-17), who led 40-36 at halftime. James Brodie tied the game at 52 for the Hornets (9-11) with 12:13 left. Longwood quickly rebounded, going on a 13-3 run that put the Lancers up 65-55 with 8:16 to play. Brandon Giles, Maurice Sumter and Lamar Barrett each scored 15 points, Clayton Morgan had 13 and Kirk Williams added 11 for Longwood. Jeremiah Lawrence led the Hornets with 17 points, Steven Johns added 15, Mouktar Fawehinmi had 12 points and eight rebounds, and Brodie had 10. Longwood scored 28 points off Shenandoah's 20 turnovers. The Hornets were held to 48.1 percent shooting, while Longwood went 52.5 percent from the field.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
